No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form =
of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the air=
 (or in other substances).=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and tran=
slate them into sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy=
.=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8=
/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:

From: Frank Ratka <warrio=
r18eii@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM











    
            
     =
       


      
      It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
A =
mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there are two different =
types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic wa=
ves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves=
 are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnieti=
c spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with =
much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anyth=
ing because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways =
we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a type =
of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical=
 effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates =
heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical =
objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place.=
 All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserve=
s energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, =
6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


F=
rom: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Mond=
ay, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thought. I am currentl=
y reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It was me and ano=
ther girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on=
 my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right nex=
t to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision cam=
era. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl th=
at was with me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.
=A0
I hav=
e long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment,=
 or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are app=
earing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with the recorders may=
 back that theory up. That other recorder should have picked that voice up =
if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attaching the clip of t=
his 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=
=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right =
after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring m=
y audio, but still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I a=
m not as excited about it as my one's from the last investigation.
=A0
=A0
=

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .=
com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas

=







I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave an=
d demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the hete=
rodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another i=
n frequency then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat freque=
ncy or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at =
54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequen=
cy at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=A0frequency at 9KH=
z, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an exampl=
e, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turnin=
g them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a =
few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not=
 only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio =
as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotli=
ght" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w=
9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June=
 8, 2009, 1:56 PM





Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are oft=
en=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the ac=
tual=A0point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digi=
tal.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:3=
9 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:





=




I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EV=
P's I captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording=
 as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.
=A0


----- Original Mess=
age ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 



Sent: Monday=
, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




I am curious =
if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP =
in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estates, n=
ear Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the t=
hree halls of the building. The video for all=A0was being monitored and rec=
orded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the cam=
era sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we might have hea=
rd if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0

 juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:

=A0
Let's just agree to end thi=
s discussion about her... 
Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note=
? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
Al

 It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves tha=

 you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost i=
s sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating=
 an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate differe=
nce frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz)=
. This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrason=
ic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP=
 were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</div>

erodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars=
